rev.comment: /* Early life and education */ is there any cite for a suicide? A Time article attributes his death to alcoholism, but it's wasn't unusual for suicides to be reported as something else
rev.diff:
Line 27: Line 27:
==Early life and education==
==Early life and education==
â
Trump is a son of [[Fred Trump|Fred Christ Trump]] (October 11, 1905 â June 25, 1999) and his wife, Mary Anne MacLeod (May 10, 1912, [[Stornoway]], Scotland â August 7, 2000), who married in 1936 and had five children, one of whom, Fred Jr., the eldest son, predeceased his parents by suicide. Trump's paternal grandparents were [[German Americans|German]] immigrants.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} His grandfather, Frederick Trump (''nÃ©'' Drumpf), immigrated to the United States in 1885 and became a naturalized American citizen in 1892. Frederick married Elisabeth Christ (October 10, 1880 â June 6, 1966)<ref>{{cite web|accessdate=2008-05-22|url=http://www.wargs.com/other/trump.html|title=Ancestry of Donald Trump|publisher=WARGS}}</ref> at [[Kallstadt]], [[Rheinland-Pfalz]], Germany, on August 26, 1902. They had three children.
+
Trump is a son of [[Fred Trump|Fred Christ Trump]] (October 11, 1905 â June 25, 1999) and his wife, Mary Anne MacLeod (May 10, 1912, [[Stornoway]], Scotland â August 7, 2000), who married in 1936. Donald was one of five children. Donald's oldest brother, Fred Jr. , died in 1981 at the age of 43.<ref>[http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,956733-4,00.html]</ref> Trump's paternal grandparents were [[German Americans|German]] immigrants.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} His grandfather, Frederick Trump (''nÃ©'' Drumpf), immigrated to the United States in 1885 and became a naturalized American citizen in 1892. Frederick married Elisabeth Christ (October 10, 1880 â June 6, 1966)<ref>{{cite web|accessdate=2008-05-22|url=http://www.wargs.com/other/trump.html|title=Ancestry of Donald Trump|publisher=WARGS}}</ref> at [[Kallstadt]], [[Rheinland-Pfalz]], Germany, on August 26, 1902. They had three children.
Trump attended the [[The Kew-Forest School]], Forest Hills, New York, as did some of his siblings. After he had some difficulties there when he was 13 years old, his parents sent him to the [[New York Military Academy]] (NYMA), hoping to direct his energy and assertiveness in a positive manner.<ref>{{cite news|accessdate=2008-05-22|url=http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C05E7D91E39F934A3575BC0A965948260|title=The empire and ego of Donald Trump|work=The New York Times|date=1983-08-07|author=Bender, Marylin}}</ref> At NYMA, in [[upstate New York]], Trump earned academic honors, and played varsity football in 1962, varsity soccer in 1963, and varsity baseball from 1962 to 1964 (baseball captain 1964). The baseball coach, Ted Dobias, a local celebrity for his work with area youth, awarded him the Coach's Award in 1964. Promoted to Cadet Captain-S4 (Cadet Battalion Logistics Officer) in his senior year, Trump and Cadet First Sergeant Jeff Donaldson (NYMA class of 1965; West Point 1969) formed a composite company of cadets, taught them advanced close-order drill, and marched them down Fifth Avenue <!-- In what city or town? --> on Memorial Day in 1964. Trump attended [[Fordham University]] for two years before transferring to the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. He graduated in 1968 with a [[Bachelor of Science]] degree in [[economics]] and concentration in [[Finance|finance]].
Trump attended the [[The Kew-Forest School]], Forest Hills, New York, as did some of his siblings. After he had some difficulties there when he was 13 years old, his parents sent him to the [[New York Military Academy]] (NYMA), hoping to direct his energy and assertiveness in a positive manner.<ref>{{cite news|accessdate=2008-05-22|url=http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9C05E7D91E39F934A3575BC0A965948260|title=The empire and ego of Donald Trump|work=The New York Times|date=1983-08-07|author=Bender, Marylin}}</ref> At NYMA, in [[upstate New York]], Trump earned academic honors, and played varsity football in 1962, varsity soccer in 1963, and varsity baseball from 1962 to 1964 (baseball captain 1964). The baseball coach, Ted Dobias, a local celebrity for his work with area youth, awarded him the Coach's Award in 1964. Promoted to Cadet Captain-S4 (Cadet Battalion Logistics Officer) in his senior year, Trump and Cadet First Sergeant Jeff Donaldson (NYMA class of 1965; West Point 1969) formed a composite company of cadets, taught them advanced close-order drill, and marched them down Fifth Avenue <!-- In what city or town? --> on Memorial Day in 1964. Trump attended [[Fordham University]] for two years before transferring to the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. He graduated in 1968 with a [[Bachelor of Science]] degree in [[economics]] and concentration in [[Finance|finance]].
